how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.For foundation:.-Find and mix shades that most closely match your skin tone..-Apply using your fingertips, a sponge, or a brush....To contour:.-Start by selecting a sculpting shade one or two tones deeper than your skin..-Apply to desired areas, like your cheekbones and jawline, to create depth and dimension..-Blend in an upward motion for the most natural look....To highlight:.-Apply highlighter on areas you want to illuminate, such as upper cheekbones, bridge of nose, chin, or Cupid's bow....For blush:.-Select a blush shade of your choice or mix shades to create your ideal color..-Apply to apples of cheeks, blending upwards for a lifting effect....Pro tip:.-Use the skin-tone shades to adjust your favorite foundation if your complexion changes throughout the year.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve loved this kit because it’s so practical and just a long lasting, versatile makeup kit. It’s also been great with my dry skin this Winter and all year long.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Realllly impressed with the formulas- creamy, blendable, lovely finishes. Wouldn’t use these as a base or even as my only concealer, but really nice to bring as a one-and-done for blush/bronzer/contour/highlight. Agree that pots are too small which leads to messy edges.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Ugh I wanted to love this so much!! I love the idea of being able to have a “face in a case” that I can bring with me on trips. In fact, I bought this palette for just that! I took it with me to Vegas, and after 4 days, you can see that I’m already down to only a few uses left with one of the colours! I really loved the feel of the product, however it definitely took a lot of product to get good coverage. I was also using a brush- so no product wasted with a sponge. Knowing I’m going to run out one colour way before all of the others, and given that I can’t replace the individual colours, it pretty much deems the palette useless for its intended purpose as a “one stop shop” to take with me travelling. For $120 Canadian, it feels extremely overpriced for a product’s novelty that no longer serves its purpose after its first use.

reviews.review_title: It has earned a spot in my drawer….

So maybe make the pans a little wider.  The colors are also very pigmented so a little goes a long way.little little wider?!?

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is a great  palette. Cream makeup with great coverage and extremely light and longwearing!

I am not a heavy makeup girl. I love to spot conceal, throw on some blush, do my brows and go about my day. I thought this pallet would be perfect for everyday because I don’t like to wear a full face daily. This pallet was everything I expected it to be! I think it would be great for travel as well! However, please note that with cream based products to SET WITH A POWDER. This pallet might not be the best for oily skin types. If you do not set this pallet with some type of powder IT WILL TRANSFER. I’m not taking any stars off for this because with any cream it’s completely expected.

reviews.review_title: Perfect for low maintenance, over 40 girlies!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’m obsessed. I’ve always been overwhelmed by techniques and advancements in beauty trends and have watched videos for years to try and learn how to become better at placement and application. I’m 40, have combination skin, and was looking for something that was simple and cream-based because I’ve noticed more creasing with other products as I am getting older. This simplifies absolutely everything, has medium coverage and I love that you can customize your shades from concealer to contour. I’m finally learning how to actually contour! Bless Makeup Forever for these palettes. I finally feel like I can keep up!  have

reviews.review_title: Please Make up Forever Make This Refillable!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brunette hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It bugs me sooooo much that you can't refill these. Yes I knew that going into my purchase.  I love this product and would buy it again over and over till the end of time, if you could buy refills for the shades you need. It would be so easy too, magnetic case and all. I just don't use all the shades up some are empty and some are almost untouched.  So, for me it's just a waste.

Love this product ! The only thing I’d love more than the whole palette would be refills of every compartment. Since my skin is really fair,I can only use the lightest concealer shade,one blush and the highlighters are too dark for me . I’d love to purchase refills for only a smaller portion on the price,since this is pretty pricey, but love this palette for my oily skin !

The darker shades are more leaning towards warm/orange or pink undertone, which are nice for bronzing my face but not great for contouring. Again, I can use something else. reviews.review_title: Not designed for light skin, doesn't wear well
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: As someone with fair skin I'm pretty disappointed in the balance of light and dark shades in the complexion side. I expected the palette to be geared towards a medium complexion and that I would need to put in a bit more effort to get it to work on my fair skin. I wasn't expecting a palette labelled light/medium to be geared towards medium/tan skin.  MUFE divides their complexion shades into light, medium, tan and deep with 8 shades per category. The light/medium palette includes: ---2 light shades (1N00 which is the lightest shade in this section, 1R12 which is the second darkest) ---1 medium shade (2N22 which is the second lightest in this section) ---2 tan shades (3N42 which is the third lightest in this section, 3N52 which is the darkest) ---1 deep shade (4N68 which is the fourth lightest in this section).  So someone with a tan complexion has a better chance of matching/blending the complexion shades in the light/medium palette than I do with my light (1N00/1N06) complexion. I've watched videos of makeup artists and makeup enthusiasts use this palette and they seem to bounce around the complexion side using different shades to highlight or contour. To make the tan and deep shades workable I have to blend in 1N00, and even then I'm pulling very orange. And I'm using so much 1N00 that I would go through it very quickly. Refills aren't available/an option so the palette would quickly become unusable.  As for how it wears, I've only had it on for 4 hours and am experiencing fading on my cheeks and forehead. I've also gotten very oily across my nose and under my eyes. I set it with powder but it's wearing very poorly.

reviews.review_text: recently had the opportunity to try out the Milk Makeup Forever HD Skin Face Essentials Full Face Cream Palette, and I must say, it has become an essential part of my makeup routine.   This palette is incredibly versatile, making it a must-have for anyone on the go. Whether you need a quick touch-up throughout the day or want to create a full face base, this palette has you covered. Personally, as a busy individual, I find it convenient to carry it in my purse and do quick makeup touch-ups in the car. With this palette, I can conceal dark circles, blemishes, and under eyes effortlessly. Additionally, it offers blush options, highlighters, and contour shades for a complete look.  One of the standout features of this palette is the range of color options available. From concealer shades to blushes and highlighters, there's something for every skin tone and occasion. However, if I were to point out a downside, it would be that I find myself favoring one of the concealer shades over the rest. When that particular shade runs out, I'll be disappointed, but it doesn't take away from the overall quality of the palette.  In conclusion, I absolutely love the Milk Makeup Forever HD Skin Face Essentials Full Face Cream Palette for its versatility, convenience, and excellent color options. It has quickly become a staple in my purse for on-the-go touch-ups, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a multi-functional makeup solution.

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Palette 1: Light to Medium - for fair to medium skin tones
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This palette is brilliant! I am going to do my best to describe usage as well as tips/tricks. Note that I have fair skin, and I went into this palette expecting to be able to use some, but not all, of the shades. Instead, I can actually use every single shade included.  First off, I noticed a texture difference between the base shades and the blush/highlight shades. Let’s start by going over the base/foundation shades. These feel like true creams. They start with a good amount of pigment and easily blend together. I found that blending the top two shades gave me a good “foundation” shade. From there, I am finding I like to use the center shades to build up faux contour/bronzer around the perimeter of my face (for a natural look). For a more glam look, the bottom two shades are a perfect warm bronzer and cool contour. These have a radiant finish and set beautifully with a dab of powder. I will note I initially struggled a bit with figuring out what brush to use. I have settled on a smaller brush designed for cream application, and prefer to use a sponge to finalize blending the entire base on my face.  The blush/highlight side has a much more emollient feel to it. As such, I found it was best to simply dip my fingers into these shades and tap gently on my skin to reduce lines of demarcation. I am SO happy to tell you that every one of these shades works well for my fair skin, and yet I do think these could work for medium skin as well. They are incredibly buildable! With one “dip” in the shades, I get a very light application, making even the two deepest shades a good fit (see photos: shade deep rose). Naturally with my fair skin, I worried the most about the deepest shades - yet I love them!  All in all, this palette is incredibly versatile, and I think MUFE really got it right in designing two shade options. I believe I am able to use every shade here because of this choice, while only one shade option might make that impossible. It’s a very impressive launch!
